title: The sounds of BepiColombo's sixth flight past Mercury
summary: Listen to the ESA/JAXA BepiColombo spacecraft as it flew past Mercury on 8 January 2025. This sixth and final flyby used the little planet's gravity to steer the spacecraft on course for entering orbit around Mercury in 2026.

title: European Launch Startups Send Open Letter to ESA Outlining Key Priorities
summary:
Six European launch startups have penned and released an open letter to ESA outlining key priorities they urge the agency to consider when implementing the European Launch Challenge. Below is the full, unedited text of the letter. You can read more about the European launcher Challenge here. Strengthening Europe’s Launch Industry Key Priorities to Shape […]
The post European Launch Startups Send Open Letter to ESA Outlining Key Priorities appeared first on European Spaceflight.

title: 40 Years Ago: STS-51C, the First Dedicated Department of Defense Shuttle Mission
summary: On Jan. 24, 1985, space shuttle Discovery took off from NASA’s Kennedy Space Center (KSC) in Florida on STS-51C, the first space shuttle mission entirely dedicated to the Department of Defense (DOD). As such, many of the details of the flight remain classified. Discovery’s crew of Commander Thomas “T.K.” Mattingly, Pilot Loren Shriver, Mission Specialists […]

title: Live coverage: SpaceX to launch 23 Starlink satellites on Falcon 9 rocket from California
summary: The Starlink 11-6 mission will be the fourth launch from Vandenberg Space Force Base so far in 2025. Liftoff from pad 4 East will take place at 6:07 a.m. PST (9:07 a.m. EST, 1407 UTC).

title: NASA Presses on With Artemis as Questions Swirl About the Future
summary: NASA awarded study contracts to nine companies today for lunar surface mobility and logistics concepts to support the Artemis program. Three days into the second Trump Administration, questions are swirling […]
